file_content.text: I suppose Hoth will have to manage without you. Good luck out there.
My lord!
Sir!
Khun Tazith asked me to keep an eye out--he wants to talk about the Bane Brigade.
My friends, I have a confession.
My Sith friend, I have a confession.
My friend, I have a confession.
When I founded the Bane Brigade fifty years ago, I never thought I'd see its equal.
I nurtured those men and women, planned every mission... sat beside them when their limbs needed replacement. I wept upon their deaths... but you have done exceptionally.
Did we succeed? Does the Republic believe the Bane Brigade is alive?
Tell me how the plan goes.
That's how you became advisor to the Minister of War. The brigade's victories were your victories.
You founded the Bane Brigade?
It was a dream: bringing the Empire's heroes together to stand against the Republic menace.
Your old friends are ashes. Focus on the present.
Enough sentiment, fool.
Of course, of course.
We intercepted a communiqu√©--the Republic is sending Jedi and Special Forces to hunt the phantom "Bane Brigade," thanks to your deception.
But they'll find only expendable Imperial troops, like those you've met in the field. And as our men die, they will drag the Republic with them into their icy graves.
Pawns must be sacrificed.
If sending a few thousand fools to their death brings victory, so be it.
Those soldiers knew what they were getting into.
Indeed. The most anyone can contribute is to die for the Empire.
Your soldiers have given everything to take this world. They don't deserve to be sacrificed.
Our troops deserve better.
Don't sympathize with those beneath you. You are a champion. They are fodder.
Besides, Hoth was always an unwinnable scenario--the point of engaging the Republic here was to sap their resources.
You found a way to lure the Republic's heroes to this worthless planet. You can find a way to truly defeat them.
I believe we can win Hoth.
Give the soldiers here an opportunity to prove themselves and take this world. They're fighters, you'll see.
So much faith... it has been a long time since I walked among our troops.
We can't afford to lose even one man. Not while the enemy outnumbers us.
Find a way to minimize losses.
You are not unreasonable. Perhaps there are ways to mitigate our sacrifice.
When word of your plan spreads, how many troops do you expect to obey?
Get ready to face mutiny.
Perhaps I will... reassess our options.
Regardless, you are needed elsewhere in the galaxy. And know that while it cannot be public, you've earned the right to call yourself part of the Bane Brigade.
Know you are the last of the greatest enemies of the Republic--and your name means fear.
Troops are on the move to Clabburn Tundra. Be careful if you join them.
Get those generators loaded and the scouts away. Second battalion leaves in thirty minutes!
Redeploying troops, Captain?
My lord--I didn't know you'd come back from the front.
Sir! We heard you were operating on the front.
Heh. So our friend the bounty hunter is back from the front.
With the pirate threat contained, orders are to refocus on the Republic. Main force is headed to Clabburn Tundra--frozen kill zone, all blizzards and canyons.
Go and fight for the Emperor and the Sith. It is your honor.
Make the Empire proud.
Proud to serve and ready to die--but I don't think it'll come to that.
I've seen what it's like on the ice. Tell your troops to stay alert.
Good luck out there.
I'll do that, but I'm not too worried.
Why move the fight to treacherous ground? What's our advantage on the tundra?
Tell me about Clabburn.
Official word from command says we know the ground and the enemy doesn't.
Enjoy fighting until your blood turns to ice. My work continues elsewhere.
I've had enough of Hoth.
Of course... you already know what's going to happen.
Confidentially? When the Bane Brigade obliterates the Republic army, it'll be spectacular.
That's enough, Captain. Return to your duties.
Yes, sir.
Khun Tazith, Special Advisor to the Minister of War.
Forgive me for not being there to shake your hand--I have great respect for your achievements, and I'd like to involve you in a special project.
You have my attention. What is it you seek?
Then speak, advisor.
The life of a Sith Lord is a busy one... but make your proposal, and I will listen.
I'll spare you a moment.
If you know who I am and you want to recruit me, you have a formidable security clearance.
I see you're well informed.
Your file was passed to me by a Sith Lord you were briefly acquainted with.
Time is money. I'm still waiting on your deposit.
People pay well to meet me.
I'll be brief.
You command a lot of power for a man without military rank.
Shouldn't you be in uniform?
Yes, I do--Darth Vengean asked me to leave retirement for a reason.
We were having a discussion. I hope you're not trying to keep something from me.
You interrupted the captain.
Information should flow a natural course.
As the captain mentioned, the war's next stage begins today. We came to Hoth to sap the Republic's strength in an unwinnable scenario.
Now we raise the stakes and force our enemies to commit their elite. I've thus employed the Bane Brigade, the finest Imperial fighters of the last war.
Keeping the Republic in a quagmire is one thing; committing our best is another.
We can't overextend ourselves.
Perceptive, but that problem is solvable.
I'm still listening....
The last war ended a long time ago. You're an old man, sending old men into battle.
You've all gone senile.
My plans do not require your approval or your respect.
It was the Bane Brigade and its Sith commanders who purged the Jedi Enclave on Genarius and set fire to the seas of Iskalon.
The Republic called them butchers and war criminals, and thought them defeated on Rhen Var. But some things aren't so easily destroyed--bringing us to your part.
It seems everything is under control. Why are we having this conversation?
Where do I fit in?
If word spreads that the Bane Brigade is on Hoth, Republic morale will plummet.
Their return would hit hard.
And they'll respond by wasting their grandest heroes on this worthless planet.
I have my own reputation. I won't work for your Bane Brigade.
I won't be second to anyone.
I would never ask you to.
Unfortunately, matters are complicated... and too sensitive to be discussed on this frequency.
Consider this an invitation to speak privately at Clabburn Tundra. I assure you, your role in Hoth's future is more vital than ever.
You ever hear of Clabburn Tundra? It's a death trap.
